question: Sophie walks 22 yards every day on her favorite walking trail, which includes 11 yards of walking on the beach and 11 yard(s) of walking on the sidewalk. On the sidewalk, Sophie walks at thrice the rate of speed that she does on the beach. If 55 minutes of her walk is spent on the beach, how long does it take for her to complete the entire 22-yard walk, in minutes?
answer:
On the beach, Sophie walks at a rate of 11 yards per 55 minutes, or 11/55 = 1/5 yards per minute.
On the sidewalk, she walks at thrice the rate of speed as when she is on the sand, or 3*1/5 = 0.6 yards per minute.
To walk 11 yard(s) on the sidewalk, it takes her 11/0.6 = <<11/0.6=18.333333333333336>>18.333333333333336 minutes.
Thus, in total, it takes Sophie 55+18.333333333333336 = <<55+18.333333333333336=73.33333333333334>>73.33333333333334 minutes to walk her favorite route.
#### 73.33333333333334
